27#include <sys/cdefs.h>
28__KERNEL_RCSID(0, "$NetBSD: i915_gem_batch_pool.c,v 1.2 2018/08/27 04:58:23 riastradh Exp $");
29
30#include "i915_drv.h"
31#include "i915_gem_batch_pool.h"
32
33/**
34 * DOC: batch pool
35 *
36 * In order to submit batch buffers as 'secure', the software command parser
37 * must ensure that a batch buffer cannot be modified after parsing. It does
38 * this by copying the user provided batch buffer contents to a kernel owned
39 * buffer from which the hardware will actually execute, and by carefully
40 * managing the address space bindings for such buffers.
41 *
42 * The batch pool framework provides a mechanism for the driver to manage a
43 * set of scratch buffers to use for this purpose. The framework can be
44 * extended to support other uses cases should they arise.
45 */
46
47/**
48 * i915_gem_batch_pool_init() - initialize a batch buffer pool
49 * @dev: the drm device
50 * @pool: the batch buffer pool
51 */
52void i915_gem_batch_pool_init(struct drm_device *dev,
53 struct i915_gem_batch_pool *pool)
54{
55 int n;
56
57 pool->dev = dev;
58
59 for (n = 0; n < ARRAY_SIZE(pool->cache_list); n++)
60 INIT_LIST_HEAD(&pool->cache_list[n]);
61}
62
63/**
64 * i915_gem_batch_pool_fini() - clean up a batch buffer pool
65 * @pool: the pool to clean up
66 *
67 * Note: Callers must hold the struct_mutex.
68 */
69void i915_gem_batch_pool_fini(struct i915_gem_batch_pool *pool)
70{
71 int n;
72
73 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&pool->dev->struct_mutex));
74
75 for (n = 0; n < ARRAY_SIZE(pool->cache_list); n++) {
76 while (!list_empty(&pool->cache_list[n])) {
77 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj =
78 list_first_entry(&pool->cache_list[n],
79 struct drm_i915_gem_object,
80 batch_pool_link);
81
82 list_del(&obj->batch_pool_link);
83 drm_gem_object_unreference(&obj->base);
84 }
85 }
86}
87
88/**
89 * i915_gem_batch_pool_get() - allocate a buffer from the pool
90 * @pool: the batch buffer pool
91 * @size: the minimum desired size of the returned buffer
92 *
93 * Returns an inactive buffer from @pool with at least @size bytes,
94 * with the pages pinned. The caller must i915_gem_object_unpin_pages()
95 * on the returned object.
96 *
97 * Note: Callers must hold the struct_mutex
98 *
99 * Return: the buffer object or an error pointer
100 */
101struct drm_i915_gem_object *
102i915_gem_batch_pool_get(struct i915_gem_batch_pool *pool,
103 size_t size)
104{
105 struct drm_i915_gem_object *obj = NULL;
106 struct drm_i915_gem_object *tmp, *next;
107 struct list_head *list;
108 int n;
109
110 WARN_ON(!mutex_is_locked(&pool->dev->struct_mutex));
111
112 /* Compute a power-of-two bucket, but throw everything greater than
113 * 16KiB into the same bucket: i.e. the the buckets hold objects of
114 * (1 page, 2 pages, 4 pages, 8+ pages).
115 */
116 n = fls(size >> PAGE_SHIFT) - 1;
117 if (n >= ARRAY_SIZE(pool->cache_list))
118 n = ARRAY_SIZE(pool->cache_list) - 1;
119 list = &pool->cache_list[n];
120
121 list_for_each_entry_safe(tmp, next, list, batch_pool_link) {
122 /* The batches are strictly LRU ordered */
123 if (tmp->active)
124 break;
125
126 /* While we're looping, do some clean up */
127 if (tmp->madv == __I915_MADV_PURGED) {
128 list_del(&tmp->batch_pool_link);
129 drm_gem_object_unreference(&tmp->base);
130 continue;
131 }
132
133 if (tmp->base.size >= size) {
134 obj = tmp;
135 break;
136 }
137 }
138
139 if (obj == NULL) {
140 int ret;
141
142 obj = i915_gem_alloc_object(pool->dev, size);
143 if (obj == NULL)
144 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
145
146 ret = i915_gem_object_get_pages(obj);
147 if (ret)
148 return ERR_PTR(ret);
149
150 obj->madv = I915_MADV_DONTNEED;
151 }
152
153 list_move_tail(&obj->batch_pool_link, list);
154 i915_gem_object_pin_pages(obj);
155 return obj;
156}
